author: Gonzalo Soto, Eric Martin, Alex Vasquez
description: Mexico’s Congress is set to vote this week on President Claudia Sheinbaum’s proposed tariffs on China, part of a broader plan to shield local producers and ease trade tensions with the US. The move is fueling expectations that it could soon make room for US tariff relief on Mexican steel and aluminum.
title: Mexico to Hike China Tariffs, Raising Hopes of US Steel Relief

author: Chris Palmeri, Kelcee Griffis, Josh Sisco
description: Just hours before Paramount Skydance Corp. Chief Executive Officer David Ellison launched a hostile bid for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., he hobnobbed in Washington with some of the federal government’s heaviest hitters.
title: Paramount Faces Lower Antitrust Bar Over Warner Bros. Bid

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: Bank of America Corp. chief executive officer Brian Moynihan, Citigroup Inc. CEO Jane Fraser and Wells Fargo & Co. CEO Charlie Scharf are scheduled to meet with senators in both parties on Thursday to discuss crypto market legislation that could soon come to a vote, according to a person familiar with the plans.
title: Bank CEOs Expected to Meet Senators on Crypto Market Structure

author: Anthony Capaccio, Roxana Tiron
description: US lawmakers are trying to compel Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to submit all unedited videos and to brief on strikes targeting alleged drug-running boats off the coast of Venezuela by targeting part of his travel budget if he doesn’t comply.
title: Defense Bill Mandates Hegseth Briefings on Drug-Boat Strikes

author: Milda Seputyte, Aaron Eglitis, Ott Tammik, Peter Guest, Sam Dodge, Rachel Lavin
description: The Baltic countries are fortifying their frontier regions as a deterrent to Russian aggression. Close to the border, communities now have to reckon with the price of peace.
title: Russia’s Threats Put Europe’s Borderlands on Edge

author: Nathan R Dean
description: The president wants to limit state regulation of the technology.
title: Trump Promises ‘One Rule’ for AI, But He May Need Congress to Act

author: Joe Lovinger
description: Texas Congresswoman Jasmine Crockett is launching a bid for the US Senate, aiming to parlay her large social media following and fundraising prowess with Democratic donors into a seat representing the Republican-dominated state.
title: Trump Foe Jasmine Crockett Unveils Bid for Texas Senate Seat

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Matt Miller discuss Paramount Skydance launching a hostile takeover bid for Warner Bros. Discovery valued at $30 a share in cash. Bloomberg's Felix Gillette and Geetha Ranganathan of Bloomberg Intelligence join the show to break it down. Also on today's show, Bloomberg's Alexandre Rajbhandari and Sri Natarajan on JPMorgan hiring Berkshire’s Todd Combs for a prominent investing role, and CSIS Critical Minerals Security Program Director Gracelin Baskaran weighs in on the ongoing global race to dominate rare earths imports for trade, tech, and more. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Paramount Launches Hostile Bid for Warner Bros. | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 12/8/2025

description: President Trump answers questions from reporters in the cabinet room after announcing $12 billion in aid to American farmers. The president spoke about the health care fight, the EU's fine on Elon Musk's social media site X and said that he is waiting to see Paramount's market percentage before weighing in further on the bid for Warner Bros. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Threatens ‘Severe’ Tariffs on Canadian Fertilizer: Q&A

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump signaled he could impose fresh tariffs on agricultural products, including Canadian fertilizer and Indian rice, the latest sign that protracted negotiations with two US trading partners could drag on.
title: Trump Eyes Tariffs Over Canadian Fertilizer, Indian Rice

description: President Donald Trump has made securing rare earth minerals that are crucial for military and high-tech applications one of his top priorities, The US has renewed a focus on not just operations abroad, including a newly vowed $1 billion for critical minerals supply chain in Congo, but also accelerating mining and processing production domestically. CSIS Critical Minerals Security Program Director Gracelin Baskaran joined Carol Massar and Matt Miller on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it down. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US 'Way Ahead' of Last Year for Rare Earths Operations, Says CSIS Critical Minerals Director

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump pressured farm-equipment manufacturers to drop prices for tractors as he announced $12 billion in farmer relief, his latest efforts to address Americans’ concerns about shaky economic conditions under his leadership.
title: Trump Urges Tractor Makers to Cut Costs as Vexed Farmers Get Aid

author: Sara Sjolin
description: The US and Greenland pledged “mutual respect” on Monday as they convened with Denmark for annual talks on cooperation in the High North.
title: US, Greenland Pledge ‘Mutual Respect’ at Talks Over the Arctic

description: Paramount Skydance launched a hostile takeover bid for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. at $30 a share in cash on Monday, just days after the company agreed to a deal with Netflix Inc. The offer values Warner Bros. at $108.4 billion, including debt, compared with Netflix’s offer of $27.75 in cash and stock. Both bids raise significant antitrust concerns, however, underscored by multibillion-dollar breakup fees the parties have offered, and both companies have been laying the groundwork to win over the White House. Both bidders are also likely to face an extended review by regulators all over the globe. Bloomberg's Felix Gilette and Geetha Ranganathan joined Matt Miller and Carol Massar on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it down. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Paramount Launches Hostile Warner Bros. Bid Just Days After Netflix Agreement

description: US Small Business Administrator Kelly Loeffler says that small business optimism is at an all-time high under Trump as the president is set to head out on the road to tout his plan to fight inflation. Loeffler said that the impact of Trump's tax cuts and deregulatory efforts will play out on main street to the benefit of business owners.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump to Travel to PA to Talk Inflation, Affordability

description:
A rally in US stocks hit pause and Treasuries joined a global bond slump ahead of the Federal Reserve’s final meeting of 2025. While a cut is all but certain, traders are growing anxious about next year’s interest-rate path.
The S&P 500 dipped Monday after the equities benchmark closed within spitting distance of an all-time high. Uncertainty over the pace of easing in 2026 and wariness about the sustainability of an AI-driven rally tempered sentiment. US stocks had rebounded in recent weeks after some Fed officials signaled they intend to cut rates for a third straight time on Wednesday. Kevin Gordon, Schwab Center for Financial Research Head of Macro Research and Strategy joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Matt Miller. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Stocks Skid as Traders Gird for Heated Fed Meeting

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses the latest news from the Trump Administration. On today's show, Finland Foreign Affairs Minister Elina Valtonen, US Small Business Administrator Kelly Loeffler, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis and Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Visiting Democracy Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Rolls Out Farm Aid Plan | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/8/2025

description: Finnish Foreign Minister Elina Valtonen says US President Donald Trump should make sure any deal with Russia to end its war in Ukraine leads to a lasting peace. She speaks with Joe Mathieu on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Russia Is NATO's Top Long-Term Threat, Finland's Valtonen Says

author: Kirsi Heikel, Joe Mathieu
description: President Donald Trump should make sure any deal with Russia to end its war in Ukraine leads to a lasting peace, said Finnish Foreign Minister Elina Valtonen.
title: Finland Says ‘Trump’s Peace’ in Ukraine Must Be Just and Lasting

author: David Voreacos, Chris Strohm
description: Alina Habba has resigned as the top US prosecutor in New Jersey, a defeat for President Donald Trump’s effort to install loyalists in key Justice Department leadership positions.
title: Habba Resigns as New Jersey US Attorney After Court Ruling

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy and his European allies agreed to continue working on security guarantees for Kyiv following discussions in London, suggesting the talks failed to deliver a breakthrough paving the way to a peace settlement with Russia that Ukraine can accept.
title: Zelenskiy Signals No Security Breakthrough in London Peace Talks

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A key US Supreme Court justice indicated he wants to protect the Federal Reserve’s independence as the conservative majority weighed giving President Donald Trump power to fire members of the Federal Trade Commission and similar independent agencies.
title: Fed Independence Risk Troubles Kavanaugh in Trump Firing Fight

author: Konrad Krasuski
description: Poland’s biggest energy utility PGE SA ousted Chief Executive Officer Dariusz Marzec a week before a regulatory decision on electricity bills.
title: Poland’s Biggest Utility Removes CEO Before Decision on Bills

author: Godfrey Marawanyika
description: Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa has fired Mines Minister Winston Chitando, who had held the post for more than a year, without giving any reasons for the decision.
title: Zimbabwe Fires Mines Minister Chitando, Elevates Kambamura

description:
Berkshire Hathaway Inc. announced a handful of leadership changes including the retirement of its longtime chief financial officer, as the $1 trillion conglomerate prepares for the retirement of Warren Buffett.
Marc Hamburg will end his 40-year tenure at the firm in 2027 and hand over his role as chief financial officer next year to Charles Chang, according to a statement Monday. Separately, Nancy Pierce will become CEO of Geico, filling a spot held by Todd Combs, a Berkshire investment manager who is leaving to take a job at JPMorgan Chase & Co. Bloomberg's Matthew Palazola joins to discuss with Paul Sweeney and Scarlet Fu (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Berkshire Hathaway Unveils Leadership Shakeup

author: Gregory Korte
description: President Donald Trump’s administration will direct agencies to cut jobs, close offices and use artificial intelligence to make the government more efficient, according to a new directive.
title: Trump Management Plan Shrinks Government, Curbs ‘Woke’ Programs

author: Nayla Razzouk
description: France is racing to forge a strategy to protect the country’s food industries against growing imports and to bolster exports, as it faces the prospect of the first agricultural trade deficit in almost half a century.
title: France Drawing Up Plan to Shield Food Output From Rival Imports

author: Antony Sguazzin
description: A state radio presenter accused by prosecutors of organizing the recruitment of South Africans to fight for Russia against Ukraine was granted bail on Monday, alongside four co-accused after appearing in a court near Johannesburg.
title: S. Africa Says Radio DJ Masterminded Russia Military Recruitment

author: Myles Miller
description: New York Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani said he wants undocumented immigrants to push back against improper law enforcement, urging residents to refuse entry, remain silent and legally record agents during an encounter.
title: Mamdani Moves to ‘Trump-Proof’ New York as ICE Tensions Rise

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: The US Congress is poised to enact bipartisan legislation that would block some Chinese biotechnology companies from government-funded contracts and authorize the Trump administration to bar US investment in Chinese AI and advanced computing.
title: Chinese Biotech, Investments Are on Track to Face New US Curbs

author: Eric Martin, Jen Judson
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the Trump administration has endorsed the Aukus security agreement with Australia and the UK following a lengthy review of the Biden-era agreement that would sell nuclear-powered submarines to Australia.
title: US Will Proceed With Aukus Security Partnership, Rubio Says

author: James Woolcock
description: UK Deputy Prime Minister David Lammy vowed to root out “corrupt actors” as the UK unveiled a new strategy targeting bankers, accountants and lawyers as part of a drive to slash the tens of billions of pounds that’s laundered through Britain every year.
title: UK Targets Lawyers, Bankers in Fresh Anti-Corruption Drive

author: Joe Lovinger
description: Former Texas Congressman Colin Allred dropped out of the Democratic primary for a US Senate seat, opting instead for an attempt to return to the House of Representatives.
title: Allred Drops Out of Texas Senate Primary to Run for US House

author: Justin Sink
description: White House National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett said it would be irresponsible for the Federal Reserve to lay out a plan for where it aims to take interest rates over the next six months, emphasizing the importance of following the economic data.
title: Hassett Says ‘Irresponsible’ to Specify Six-Month Fed Plan

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said he would approve an executive order this week to establish “ONE RULE” on artificial intelligence regulation and limit state-level policies regulating the technology.
title: Trump Says He’ll Sign Executive Order Curbing State AI Rules

author: Helen Nyambura
description: Tanzanian authorities have banned anti-government protests planned for the nation’s Independence Day and said only people with emergencies should leave their houses.
title: Tanzania Bans Independence Day Protests, Activists Urge Turnout

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: Ivory Coast President Alassane Ouattara has been sworn in for a fourth term following a landslide victory in October elections from which his main rivals were barred from running.
title: Ivory Coast Swears-In Ouattara for Another Five-Year Term

author: Shruti Srivastava, Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: Two separate US delegations are in New Delhi this week to hold talks with their India counterparts, seeking to repair bilateral ties even as a trade deal remains elusive.
title: US, India Seek to Reset Ties as Trade Deal Remains Elusive

author: Alan Crawford
description: The Kremlin has welcomed the change of tone  outlined in a new US strategy paper.
title: Trump’s MAGA Security Leaves Europe Adrift

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Olesia Safronova
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said negotiators discussing a US-brokered peace initiative remain divided over territory as President Donald Trump expressed disappointment in Kyiv’s handling of the deal.
title: Zelenskiy Says No Accord Yet on Ukraine’s East in US Talks

author: Marton Kasnyik
description: Hungary’s budget gap continued to widen in November after Fitch Ratings cut the outlook on Hungary’s second-lowest investment grade on Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s pre-election spending.
title: Hungary’s Budget Gap Widens to $12.4 Billion, Fitch Cuts Outlook

author: Ruth Olurounbi
description: Nigerian authorities have secured the release of 100 students who were among those kidnapped from a Catholic school in the country’s north last month.
title: Nigeria Wins Release of 100 Schoolchildren Kidnapped Last Month

description: US President Donald Trump raised potential antitrust concerns around Netflix Inc.’s planned $72 billion acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. The transaction would combine the world’s No. 1 streaming player with HBO Max and the Justice Department’s antitrust division could argue that the deal is illegal because the combined market share would put Netflix well over a 30% threshold. Lawmakers have already faulted the transaction as harmful to consumers. Bloomberg’s Manuel Baigorri breaks down
title: Netflix-Warner Deal May Pose Problem, Trump Warns

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, President Donald Trump says he’s disappointed in Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s handling of a US proposal to end the war that began with Russia’s full-scale invasion. Investors begin to focus on the Federal Reserve, with Chair Jerome Powell expected to push through another quarter-point interest-rate cut this week, despite growing unease among some policymakers that inflation remains too high. And JPMorgan CEO, Jamie Dimon, says Europe is facing a real problem as slow bureaucracy drives out business and innovation.

Today's guest: Pilar Gomez-Bravo, Co-CIO of fixed income at MFA Investment Management. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump 'Disappointed' in Zelenskiy On Ukraine Talks| Daybreak Europe 12/08/2025

author: Katarina Hoije
description: Nigeria’s military sent fighter jets and ground forces into neighboring Benin to support President Patrice Talon, after a group of soldiers attempted to seize control of the West African nation.
title: Nigeria Sends Soldiers, Jets Into Benin to Stop Coup Attempt

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will host Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy in London to discuss US proposals to end the war with Russia. European leaders including French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Friedrich Merz will join the talks. Meanwhile, President Donald Trump said he’s disappointed in Zelenskiy’s handling of a US proposal to end the war. Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook breaks down the situation.
title: Zelenskiy in London at Key Moment for Ukraine Talks

author: Andra Timu, Irina Vilcu
description: The candidate of Romania’s Liberal party won the mayoral race for Bucharest, strengthening the position of Prime Minister Ilie Bolojan inside the ruling coalition as he pushes through a package of austerity measures to trim the European Union’s widest budget deficit.
title: Romanian Premier-Backed Candidate Wins Mayoral Race in Bucharest

author: Katherine Griffiths, Harry Wilson, Leonard Kehnscherper
description: Reform is invoking Margaret Thatcher’s Big Bang to woo the UK’s flagship industry
title: Farage’s Party Turns on the Charm for City of London’s Bankers

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The United Nations is asking member states for $33 billion to help people in need of humanitarian assistance around the globe, the organization’s most modest ask in the past half-decade amid member state budget constraints and a lack of US funding.
title: UN Needs $33 Billion for Aid as Crises Grow, Funding Shrinks

author: Chandra Asmara, Eko Listiyorini
description: Indonesia will need 51.8 trillion rupiah ($3.2 billion) to rebuild areas devastated by recent floods and landslides in Sumatra, according to the national disaster agency.
title: Indonesia Expects $3 Billion Rebuild After Deadly Floods

author: Khine Lin Kyaw
description: Myanmar’s economy will contract this year amid civil war and ongoing drag from a March earthquake, according to the World Bank, which sees growth also constrained by weak domestic demand, labor shortages and frequent power outages.
title: World Bank Sees Myanmar’s Economy Shrinking on Conflict, Quake

author: Arne Delfs, Colum Murphy
description: German Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul arrived in China for a two-day visit that will focus on trade, rare earths and the war in Ukraine — the nations’ latest effort to reset ties that have been tested in recent months.
title: Germany’s Top Diplomat Touts Trade With China to Start Visit

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Gerson Freitas Jr
description: The Trump administration on Monday plans to unveil a long-awaited farm aid package, according to a White House official, offering $12 billion in assistance to a key base of support hit hard by low crop prices and the impact of the president’s tariff policies.
title: Trump to Unveil $12 Billion in Long-Awaited Farm Aid Program

author: Sakura Murakami, Alastair Gale
description: Beijing and Tokyo traded complaints against each other as their simmering diplomatic spat intensified over the weekend after Chinese fighter aircraft allegedly trained their fire-control radar systems on Japanese military jets.
title: Japan, China Trade Accusations as Spat Deepens After Radar Use

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korea is preparing to relocate the presidential office back to the Blue House in a move aimed at erasing former leader Yoon Suk Yeol’s legacy a year after his failed bid to put the country under martial law triggered months of political instability.
title: South Korea to Move Presidential Office to Roll Back Yoon Legacy

author: Randy Thanthong-Knight, Philip Heijmans
description: Thailand launched air strikes on Cambodian military sites Monday after a deadly border skirmish, the most dramatic escalation in months that endangers a peace deal demanded by President Donald Trump.
title: Thai F-16s Hit Cambodia in Blow to Trump-Backed Peace Plan

description: President Donald Trump says he’s disappointed in Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s handling of a US proposal to end the war that began with Russia’s full-scale invasion. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Voices Disappointment in Zelenskiy as Talks Drag

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said he’s disappointed in Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s handling of a US proposal to end the war that began with Russia’s full-scale invasion.
title: Trump Voices Disappointment in Zelenskiy as Peace Talks Drag

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s economy shrank in the three months through September, the government confirmed in a revised report, giving some justification for Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s stimulus package announced last month.
title: Japan Confirms Deeper GDP Decline, Backing Takaichi’s Stimulus

author: Alex Morales
description: Key European leaders including UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will huddle with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy in London in a bid to steer US-led peace talks toward a resolution that protects Ukraine from the prospect of future Russian aggression.
title: Europe Leaders to Meet Zelenskiy at Pivotal Moment for Peace

author: Ellen Milligan
description: As Defence Secretary John Healey talks up his plans to buttress the UK military, doubts over funding and Britain’s ability to move fast enough are unsettling the industry and armed forces.
title: UK’s Bold Defense Plans Face Doubt Over Spending Gaps
